job.title: Sr. Product Manager - API / Core Platform Services
Technical Lead - Banking Operations (Remote - Work from Anywhere)
Delivery Management Lead
job.description:
As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.

Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.

To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.


Do you want to be part of the future of finance? Are you excited about solving problems that have never been solved before? Do you get a buzz from mentoring and helping others succeed?

The impact you will have:

As Delivery Management Lead you will be responsible for mentoring the growing number of delivery managers to help them and their product-engineering teams go smoothly from idea conception through to successful launch. This will require you to empower them, encourage the sharing of best practice and putting in place processes and procedures to help them flourish.

However, you’ll also be hands on with delivery as you work with at least one product-engineering team as their delivery manager. This will enable you to be hands on with the design and build; challenging engineers about design choices, product managers about functionality and learn in depth about our tech, stack and tooling.

What you will do:

  • Steer the growing delivery management function by mentoring and managing the delivery managers
  • Put in place best practice, efficient process and knowledge sharing opportunities to level up the delivery management function
  • Report to key stakeholders and the senior management team about key delivery metrics and progress
  • Work collaboratively with the Product Managers and Tech Leads to define the roadmap for your product-engineering team/s, and ensure resource and capacity is mapped out especially where there are cross team dependencies or blockers
  • Coordinate with the Delivery Managers to ensure release timelines, map dependencies and ensure alignment across the entire Product-Engineering function
  • Evolve processes and methodologies to build fun, efficient and scalable delivery teams
  • Facilitate agile ceremonies in the scrum master role and share best practice with other delivery managers
  • Develop and own communication plans to effectively and proactively communicate project status, issues, and risks to stakeholders
  • Own the release planning process for your product-engineering team/sto ensure engineers, product and key stakeholders are all aligned and ready for on-time and successful releases

You will be a great fit here if you:

  • You’re a people person and love to help others develop and grow in their roles
  • You enjoy taking both the macro view as well as diving deep into the details on a project
  • You’re naturally curious, love learning new things, and are proactive in sharing knowledge with others.
  • You possess a strong sense of urgency in driving projects to completion while achieving the desired business outcomes.
  • You are comfortable collaborating with client facing teams as well as technical teams to creatively solve complex problems
  • You want to build deep technical and product knowledge to work with the product managers and engineers to create innovative solutions and products, and to be able to collaborate with engineers on technical choices and cross team dependencies.

Our ideal candidate has:

  • Successfully led delivery teams previously and/or has a strong focus on mentoring and managing
  • A proven track record of resolving issues and risks in a cross functional and collaborative way both at the macro function level as well as a product-engineering team level
  • Experience of managing a product backlog and roadmap driven by multiple stakeholders and priorities
  • A track record of success in delivering complex and cross team projects within the SaaS sector
  • Used a variety of delivery methodologies, including Scrum, Kanban and Waterfall as well as a wide range of project management tooling; ZenHub, JIRA, Asana, Confluence, etc

Bonus Points for:

  • Knowledge or experience within the cryptocurrency/blockchain sector
  • Share Options
  • Holiday - 25 days + public holidays
  • Private Health Insurance - we use Vitality!
  • Work Pension Scheme
  • Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite
  • Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription
  • Home office allowance
  • Enhanced parental leave; we provide eligible employees, regardless of gender or whether they become a parent by birth or adoption, 16 weeks fully-paid leave and job-protected leave
  • Full access to Spill Mental Health Support
  • Our offices provide all of the amenities you could need
  • Work with top of the range equipment - MacBook Pro and any other equipment you need

We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.

job.title: Enterprise Account Executive, LATAM (Spanish-speaking)
Associate, Finance and Operations
job.location: New York City, Bay Area, or Puerto Rico
job.description:
Pantera Capital is the first institutional US-based asset management firm focused exclusively on blockchain and digital assets. We manage over $5bn in equity and tokens across liquid (long / short) and illiquid (venture) strategies.

We are seeking to hire a Finance & Operations Associate to join the Co-investments and Special Opportunities team based in any of our offices (Bay Area, New York, Puerto Rico). This role reports into the Head of Special Opportunities.

We are looking for an intellectually curious and detail-oriented team player who has previously covered venture and/or growth equity funds in a fast-paced investment management firm. The ideal candidate is experienced in creating and improving processes such as cash flow management, client management within Salesforce, and subscription document life cycle.

Additional responsibilities include: assisting with investor follow-ups, document and client distribution list management, and data room setup.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensuring accuracy of Limited Partner ("LP") information throughout the subscription process, including precise calculation of allocations based on co-investment rights.
  • Managing communication with existing and prospective LPs, with particular focus on the notification process for capital calls and distributions.
  • Maintaining accurate investor data in the CRM (Salesforce), including tracking and timely replies to ad-hoc LP requests.
  • Partnering closely with the Finance and Accounting team to file and track documents, reconcile cash flows, and manage any outstanding communications cross-functionally to provide a seamless LP experience.
  • Bonus points for ability to implement automation and efficiency improvements to existing processes.

    • Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, finance, or similar, with a strong academic background at a highly ranked school.
  • 3+ years of experience in a comparable industry such as investment management, investment banking, management consulting, public accounting, fund administration. Experience with private and alternative investment fund structures preferred.
  • Excellent Excel and financial analytical skills.

    • Desired Skills:
  • Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment.
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adequately prioritize.
  • Extreme attention to detail and concern for quantitative accuracy, given high-visibility of these activities with limited partners and portfolio companies.
  • High EQ and ability to cultivate relationships both internally (cross-functionally) and externally (to improve overall client relationship).
  • Impeccable work ethic.
  • Ability to roll up their sleeves and do anything and everything to get the job done

    • Compensation:
  • Compensation is competitive and based on experience
  • Salary plus performance based bonus
  • Healthcare
  • 401k matching

job.title: Data Center Facilities Technician
job.description:
About ANKR

Ankr provides Web3 infrastructure for easy, accessible and affordable deployment of blockchain nodes, API’s, decentralized staking infrastructure and Layer 2 scaling solutions, designed to lower the entry barrier for everyday people, enterprises, and developers to contribute to blockchain ecosystems.

Check us out at https://www.ankr.com/

Ankr was founded in 2017 in Berkeley, California. Its founding team and headquarters are based in San Francisco. Ankr’s distributed team of 50+ people operates from offices in San Francisco, Shanghai, Moscow, and Amsterdam.

Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service.

The Data Center Facilities Technician will be responsible for performing repairs, corrective maintenance, and complex installations, training can be provided.


What we are looking for in a Data Center Facilities Technician:

  • Performs site inspections and monitors the building and alarms
  • You will be responsible for performing preventative maintenance on site infrastructure (e.g. maintenance of primary infrastructures)
  • Undertakes repairs and corrective maintenance
  • Assists in coordinating critical infrastructure
  • You are responsible for completion of site logs and data gathering for permits, such as MOPs and scripts
  • You are expected to respond to all on-site incidents and take action as required
  • May instruct on-site staff during simple incidents
  • Completes complex work requests and circuit installations
  • Effectively collaborates with internal and external departments
  • Provides input to your peers for complex / critical maintenance activities
  • Works through issues in a confident, positive way; is able to influence without authority
  • Carries out more complex infrastructure projects
  • High School Diploma
  • Able to perform all essential job functions, including walking, standing, bending, stooping, climbing, lifting and manual dexterity, with or without reasonable accommodation
  • Ability to work days/nights/weekends/holidays, if needed and/or required

Ankr is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Internal Communication Director
job.description:
We're looking for a driven Communications Director to join our team. You’ll work cross-functionally with team members across the organization on projects big and small to help reach and capture our audiences and communities with important updates and support key partner and partnership communications.
The dynamic nature of this role requires that the ideal candidate has a great attitude and working knowledge of the blockchain/NFT space (plus a strong appetite to build on that knowledge!). We are looking for someone creative and eager to grow as part of our team and able to flourish in the fluidity of the role. The role will be seen as a business storyteller and must interact seamlessly with a broad range of individuals including members of the engineering and product teams, community and social teams as well as key external partners.

A little about us:

Dapper team members are humble and curious entrepreneurs, builders, and tinkerers who share a passion to demystify blockchain technology and tap its potential to create change in the world. Our people are our greatest strength: our diverse crew flourishes in a distributed hierarchy where personal autonomy and professional growth are encouraged. We value our culture above all else: regardless of where you came from, what you studied, or who you used to work for, your role here will necessitate both a high level of creativity and strategic thinking on complex issues. Everyone here is a founder, and no one fits in a box. We’re all driven by an insatiable thirst for learning and development, and that’s what brings us together.

What we will accomplish together:
  • Ensuring our company voice and goals are shared with stakeholders in thoughtful, digestible and transparent ways
  • Managing company website content and blog, while building out a repository of impressive communications assets for external and internal use, all that help tell our amazing and evolving story
  • Managing core media monitoring activity
  • Supporting company social media activity
  • Supporting partner communication initiatives thoughtfully, diligently and strategically
  • Take on special projects with gusto

    • A little bit about you:
  • You thrive under pressure from multiple angles, laugh a lot, and enjoy working with passionate people.
  • Passion for communications with previous experience and demonstrated ability to communicate to all levels within an organization.
  • Strong subject matter specific writing skills
  • You are capable of applying your skills yourself, with a team, and across a variety of use cases.
  • We believe in processes and the power of planning, but you will often have to roll with the punches and prioritize the most impactful tasks on the fly.
    • More about Dapper Labs:

    Dapper Labs is the world's first blockchain entertainment company. We are the creators of industry-leading experiences including CryptoKitties and NBA Top Shot, as well as Dapper Wallet, the simplest way to manage your assets and use the blockchain. We are also the original developers behind Flow, a new decentralized blockchain designed from the ground up for scalability and ease of use.

    Our mission at Dapper Labs is to make the world a more open, empowering, and enjoyable place through consumer adoption of decentralized technologies. We have raised over $600M from leading VCs including Fred Wilson (USV) and Chris Dixon as well as Venrock, Samsung, Google Ventures, Coatue, NBA players, and global artists, among others. Dapper Labs partners include the NBA and NBPA, the NFL-PA, Ubisoft, Warner Music, Turner, Dr. Seuss, Genies, and the UFC, as well as 100+ others.

    Visit our website to learn even more about Dapper Labs, including information about benefits and perks.
